string-array.name: sat_guardian_guideline_texts
string-array.item: Take a photo showing the antennas are securely in the right connections, as well as the base plate adaptor connecting to the Guardian is secure and pointing towards the sky.
Show two cable ties securing the frame to the Guardian.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Show all solar panels are secured to the frame using the bolts, show all panels and some background.
Show base plate orientation and number of screws and whether flat or vertical. Showing at least 6 to 8 screws securing the baseplate.
Show the baseplate is flatly mounted, either horizontally on an adequately sized branch or vertically on the trunk with the Guardian attached.
Take a photo of the arm being angled 45 downs, if used.
Set your camera phone to a 10 second timer, place the camera on top of the panels facing the sky and take a photo of what is directly above the panels. (There should be ample clear sky)
Take a photo of the microphone cover cable tied to the mic mount.
Take a photo of the canopy above the satellite antenna (you should ideally show no to very little canopy cover)
Take a photo of the satellite antenna, directly facing towards the sky, none of the radials (legs) touching the tree, cabled tied to the mount and 1 meter away from the Guardian box
Take a photo of the GPS antenna flat on a horizontal branch with 2 screws.

string-array.name: cell_guardian_guideline_texts
string-array.item: Take a photo showing the antennas are securely in the right connections, as well as the base plate adaptor connecting to the Guardian is secure and pointing towards the sky.
Show two cable ties securing the frame to the Guardian.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Take a photo of each of the 4 solar panels connections showing they are completely pushed into the frame plug.
Show all solar panels are secured to the frame using the bolts, show all panels and some background.
Show base plate orientation and number of screws and whether flat or vertical. Showing at least 6 to 8 screws securing the baseplate.
Show the baseplate is flatly mounted, either horizontally on an adequately sized branch or vertically on the trunk with the Guardian attached.
Take a photo of the arm being angled 45 downs, if used.
Set your camera phone to a 10 second timer, place the camera on top of the panels facing the sky and take a photo of what is directly above the panels. (There should be ample clear sky)
Take a photo of the microphone cover cable tied to the mic mount.
Take a photo of the GSM antenna pointing towards the sky, cable tied to the mount which is screwed to the branch with 2 screws.
